_meanings:
{@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of the
guardian elephant (of the west
or s. w.)

{@--5@} A
special kind of material of the black
pigment, such as antimony (used
as collyrium, lamp-black &c.) ({#sOvIra#})

{@--9@} ({#naM#}
{#nA#}) (<ab>Rhet.</ab>) A suggested meaning; also
the process by which such meaning is
suggested. It is the power of 
suggestion (founded on {#aBiDA#} or {#lakzaRA#}
denotation or indication), by which
something else is understood from
a word which, though having more
meanings than one, has been 
restricted to a single meaning by
relations of conjunction, 
disjunction &c. ({#saMyoga, viprayoga, sAhacarya#}, 
{#viroDitA#} &c.), or, briefly, the use of
a word of several meanings in a
special sense determined by the
context; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} {#saSaMKacakro hariH#} the 
adjective restricts Hari to mean ‘Vishṇu’
alone, and not ‘a lion’ or ‘monkey’;
so {#rAmalakzmaRO dASaraTI, rAmArjunO#} 
{#BArgavakArtavIryO#} &c.; <ab>cf.</ab> {#anekArTasya Sabdasya#} 
{#vAcakatve niyaMtrite .#} 
{#saMyogAdyEravAcyArTaDIkfdvyApftiraMjanaM ..#} <ls>K. P. 2.</ls>, <ls>S. D. 23-6</ls>; See
{#vyaMjanA#} also.

<ab>N.</ab> of a vegetable perfume
({#hawwavilAsinInAmakaM gaMDadravyaM#} 
{#yatsaMyogAtkeSasyAtIva kfzRatvaM#}) (<ab>Mar.</ab> {#naKalA#}).

a swelling of the eye-lid,
stye.

a stick or pencil for
the application of collyrium.
